intro: Lepidium lyratum var. persicum, commonly known as Persian cress, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent aroma. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. This variety is often cultivated for its peppery flavor and used in culinary applications.
